summary:
Petrophysicist working with Royal Dutch Shell plc (Shell) for 10 years. Worked across three Shell locations, namely, Shell Bangalore, Petroleum Development Oman (Joint venture of Shell) and Nederlandse Aardolie Maatschappij (Shell Netherlands). 

Worked across various domain of Petrophysics such as Operations, Well & reservoir management, Field development studies, exploration projects, well abandonment, CCS project and subsurface data analytics project. 

Strong technical skills include Operations Petrophysics (data acquisition planning, execution & interpretation) for new well operations, WRFM surveillance for production restoration & optimization, Petrophysical analyses & modeling for formation evaluation & integrated reservoir modeling. 

Other strengths include resilience, self-motivated, multitasking, enjoy working in multidisciplinary teams and multicultural environment, passion for coaching & mentoring, effective communication, networking skills & stakeholder management, passionate to work for oil and gas companies.

projects.title: Project on Image Mosaicing (done out of interest as a part of Digital Image Processing Course)
projects.description: We used the concept of 3-D based navigation to browse large-photo collections and created the Image-Mosaic of the main administration building of IIT Roorkee from self-captured images. We took around 800 images daily near the building amounting to 5032 images in total which were later reduced to 2011 images after the removal of redundant data. Concepts of Edge Matching, Histogram Equalization, SIFT (Scale-Invariant Feature Transform) algorithm and other image processing techniques were then used on the image data. The final result was presented in the form of one stitched image of the building. This concept can be used for intuitive interaction with large image datasets and will be very useful for interactive games, movies etc.

profile_positions.title: Petrophysicist, Shell Netherlands

profile_positions.description:
Bahja Rima asset is an oil asset in South Oman consisting of around 30 fields. Below are some of the key contributions:

•	Operations Petrophysicist for 26 new wells (Appraisal wells, Infill producers, Water injectors & Deepwater disposal wells) spread across 11 fields of Bahja Rima asset. Operational PP duties included:

	Organized and participated in pre-spud & LWOP meetings.
	Planned and rolled out various data acquisition programs (wireline logging, LWD, coring, downhole fluid sampling, RCA, SCAL)
	Followed-up the drilling, coring, fluid sampling & logging operations remotely from office as well as physically on wellsites.
	QC’ed before acceptance of standard and non–standard OH logs, downhole pressures & fluid samples. 
	Evaluated logs, interpreted the results and proposed perforations, sidetracking or other options during well completion meetings.
	Acquired & interpreted cement bond logs to ensure wellbore integrity of the drilled wells.
	Contract handling: ensured adherence to contract & SOP for all logging, coring & sampling jobs, QC’ed and approved invoices, participated & raised service quality issues in SQMs for different vendors. 
	PP data management: QC’ed open hole & cased hole log data, formation tops, perforation intervals for uploading to RECALL & other databases. PP contribution to EOWS (End of Well Summaries) reports.

• Long term Closed-in wells review, Yibal asset –North Oman : As part of integrated team, reviewed long term closed-in wells of Yibal asset and allotted them for abandonment, restoration/ repair or other alternatives. The other deliverables include FUP (Further Use Proposal) for every reviewed well, Opportunity inventory of potential gains, Potential to deliver gains using low cost intervention methods & appropriate technology, Feedback on available data quality & gaps.
profile_positions.title: Operations Petrophysicist, PDO (Joint venture Shell)

profile_positions.description:
I have worked on a variety of projects in Shell Bangalore for different Shell Operating units across the globe. Below are some of the key projects:

SDB, Shell Deepwater Borneo exploration project: Formation evaluation for multiple wells for exploration well targets in the A, CA1 and CA2 blocks, offshore Borneo.

Abadi project: Abadi field is a large offshore gas condensate green field in Indonesia. Below are some of the key contributions during the Abadi field development:
•	Saturation Height function (SHF) modelling: Modelled the SHF for Abadi field using the SCAL data of all wells which was used in static and dynamic models after upscaling. Collaborated with the CCOE team to predict the correct value for Interfacial tension as a SHF input using molecular simulations. 
•	Quanti elan modelling: Completed the quanti elan modelling for the Abadi field and validated the operator’s porosity model. The work helped to understand the volumetrics difference between Shell and operator.
•	Uncertainty analysis: Completed the uncertainty analysis on petrophysical parameters which was an input for the static modelling and different subsurface realizations.
•	Properties upscaling: Upscaled the porosity, permeability, SHF in order to use them further for static modeling.
•	Petrophysical properties cutoffs: Refined the PP properties cutoffs for defining net sand which resulted in two subsurface models (GIIP model & Flow model) thus leading to better quantification of in-place & UR volumes.
•	Facies modelling: Created electrofacies for facies modelling of Abadi field to capture the reservoir heterogeneity and its impact on production profile.
